description: Made from strong wood, all doors are 2 inches thick guards should be at the extreme northern stretch of wall. and have hardness 5 and 20 hit points. They are unlocked. Each round, they move 20 feet clockwise. For statistics, see
name: Doors

description: Most rooms are dark, though sconces at tactical encounter 3–1 (page 58). 10-foot intervals hold unlit torches. 2. Entrance: The only entrance to Tolstoff Keep is a single
name: Illumination

description: The keep is encircled by a wall (Climb DC 20) that is 40 feet tall. See page 54 for details.
name: Outer Wall

description: The main gate is made of 2-inch-thick iron. It has a break DC of 28, hardness 10, and 60 hit points. The gate is secured but can be opened with a successful DC 30 Open Lock check.
name: Main Gate

description: Stained glass windows (each with hardness 1 and 1 hit point) permit some light to shine in from the north end of the room. Additionally, the candles in the antechamber (area 15) produce shadowy illumination in the first 4 squares beyond the door.
name: Illumination

description: The ceiling in this room is 20 feet high.
name: Ceiling Height

description: An altar stands upon a short dais. Characters who stand on the dais gain a +1 circumstance bonus on attack rolls against opponents standing on the floor.
name: Altar and Dais

description: Two side chambers hold priestly vest- ments, censers, and other religious accoutrements. The doors are unlocked.
name: Side Chambers

description: Twelve pews are arranged in two rows of six. It costs 2 squares of movement to enter a square containing a pew. Those who climb onto a pew gain a +1 circumstance bonus on attack rolls against opponents standing on the floor.
name: Pews

description: The number of hit points and the hardness of The Much Kill is a beefed-up version of the caravel—a relatively each rigging section. advanced type of sailing ship. The statistics block presented
name: Rigging hp

name: Draft

name: Seaworthiness

name: AC

name: Hull Sections

name: Sink

description: A great deal of blood has been spilled near Atk Options true strike the main mast. Characters standing in a square that contains Special Actions alternate form spilled blood must succeed on a DC 5 Balance check each round Abilities Str 13, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 9, Cha 8 or fall prone. Feats Alertness
name: Spilled Blood

description: Weak light streams down from the space at the top of the ladder and through the grating of the cargo hatch. The lower deck remains in shadowy illumination, and everyone in the area has concealment.
name: Illumination

description: The ceiling in this room rises 7 feet overhead.
name: Ceiling Height

description: Crates and boxes are scattered around the lower deck. Characters standing in a space containing a crate gain cover.
name: Crates

description: The ladder leads up to the main deck. Characters on the ladder who fight opponents on the lower deck gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls for being on higher ground.
name: Ladder

description: Several doors lead to other rooms, as shown on the map of the ship (page 73). Each door is unlocked and has hard- ness 5 and 10 hit points.
name: Doors

description: Each section of the ship’s hull has hardness 8 and 120 hit points. If any 5-foot section of the hull is breached, water pours into the lower deck. If twelve sections of the hull are breached, the caravel sinks.
name: Exterior Walls

description: The lower deck’s interior walls have hardness 5 and 60 hit points.
name: Interior Walls

description: The floorboards are weak and rotting. Each 5-foot section has hardness 2 and 30 hit points. Medium or larger characters who step on the square that has diagonal shad- Trapdoor: The floor has a 10-foot-square trapdoor in the ing fall through the floor and land in the hold. They take 1d6 space indicated by the dashed line. A successful DC 10 Strength points of damage from the fall and must contend with the kython check opens it, revealing the hold below, but there is no ladder (see tactical encounter 4–3 on the next page). to climb down.
name: Weak Floor

description: The masts (circular symbols along the center line of The area has the following features. the ship) provide cover to anyone standing behind them. Each
name: F EATURES OF THE A REA Masts

description: The ceiling in the hold rises 7 feet overhead.
name: Ceiling Height

description: The ceiling contains a trapdoor in the space in- dicated by the dashed lines. From within the hold, a PC can push the trapdoor open by making a successful DC 10 Strength check.
name: Trapdoor

description: Parallel beams—the skeleton of the Much Kill— crisscross the floor of the hold. Each beam is approximately 1 foot wide. A character can move across the slippery beams at half speed by succeeding on a DC 12 Balance check. Those who move faster than half speed take a –5 penalty on the check. Anyone who fails the check by 5 or more slips into the brackish water. The kython does not have its movement impaired in the hold and can move freely throughout the area.
name: Beams

description: Water to a depth of 3 feet fills the gaps between the beams. Because the floor is uneven, PCs cannot run or charge while in the hold. If a character is not standing on a beam, en- tering a water-filled square costs 2 squares of movement.
name: Water

description: Each section of the ship’s hull has hardness 8 and 120 hit points. If any 5-foot section of the hull is breached, water pours into the lower deck. If twelve sections of the hull are breached, the caravel sinks.
name: Exterior Walls

description: The remains of the hold’s interior walls have hardness 5 and 60 hit points. They provide cover to anyone standing behind them.
name: Interior Walls

description: The only doors in the warehouse are 10-foot-wide The warehouse has the following features. cargo doors in the southern and eastern walls. The doors are
name: F EATURES OF THE A REA Doors

description: The warehouse is lit by five everburning torches. made of reinforced wood and have hardness 7 and 30 hit points. Four are ensconced in the corners of the room, and another is They open both inward and outward. on the wall directly opposite the eastern cargo doors. Staircase: A spiral staircase is hidden under a crate to the
name: Illumination

description: The walls in the warehouse have AC 3, hardness 9, left of the center of the warehouse. The crate is empty and offers and 100 hit points. At 14 inches thick, they are sturdier than no resistance when moved. the walls of a typical storehouse. They are composed of thick Upper Windows: The only windows in the warehouse are wood with overlaid mortar, making them difficult to scale near the tops of the northern and western walls, about 25 feet (Climb DC 27). above the floor. If the PCs enter through a window, they must
name: Walls

description: The room is lit by four everburning torches, one in each corner.
name: Illumination

description: The walls are hewn from 3-foot-thick stone and gets lost, and is never caught fl at-footed. have hardness 8, 540 hit points, and a break DC of 50. They can be scaled with successful DC 22 Climb checks. THE SOTH TARNEL
name: Walls

description: If the PCs come here during the day, some light filters into the cave. The first 20 feet beyond the cave entrance is in bright illumination, the next 20 feet is in shadowy illumination, and the remainder of the cave is in darkness.
name: Illumination

description: The water in the cave is rough (Swim DC 15), but the relative shelter keeps it from being as turbulent as the water outside. At low tide, the water in the cavern is 30 feet deep.
name: Water

description: The surfaces of the rock ledge and the partially submerged rock shelf are extremely slippery and uneven. A successful DC 15 Balance check is required to run or charge across either surface. A failed check indicates that the character cannot move farther in that round (but can take other actions).
name: Slick Rock Floor

description: The minotaurs use the other alcove as their living space. Much of the floor is covered in a thick layer of rugs, discarded cloth, and the half-eaten remains of unidentifi- able food. Treat the area as if it were light rubble (DMG 60).
name: Living Area

description: A crevasse 10 feet wide and 30 feet deep cuts through the center of the landing. It can be crossed on a suc- cessful DC 10 Jump check; anyone who fails the check falls in and takes 3d6 points of damage. The walls of the crevasse are rough, so anyone who falls in can climb back out with a suc- cessful DC 15 Climb check. The minotaurs use the crevasse as a dumping ground for garbage, and it holds all manner of foul, unwholesome, and useless objects.
name: Crevasse

description: The fl oors throughout Gilgirn are fl agstone. Each Disable Device check. fl oor is at least 5 feet thick by necessity, since a typical fi re Temperature: The volcanic cavern is bearably hot, giant weighs approximately 7,000 pounds. but the temperature within Gilgirn is 90 degrees F,
name: Floors

description: The ground-level doors are carved from 8-inch- requiring visitors to make successful Fortitude saves to thick stone. Each door is 10 feet wide and 15 feet high and avoid nonlethal damage (DMG 303). Within 30 feet of lava, has hardness 8 and 120 hit points. The doors on the second the temperature exceeds 110 degrees F, requiring more and third levels are carved from 4-inch-thick stone. Each frequent saves. upper-level door is 5 feet wide and 13-1/2 feet high and has hardness 8 and 60 hit points. DEFENSES
name: Doors

Outside the walls, the ceiling of the volcanic fi re giant guards or death maidens, the entire fortress goes cavern is 150 feet above the main lava throat. on alert. The These canals are 5 feet deep and filled with rocks that fire following areas correspond with those on the map on giants can reach in and grab for throwing. name: Lava Canals

description: The double doors of the gatehouse are carved from 1-foot-thick stone. Each door is 10 feet wide and 15 feet high and has hardness 8 and 180 hit points.
name: Doors

description: The gatehouse contains two levels and a lookout. Two fire giants stand outside the open stone doors, two more are stationed on the second floor to operate the portcullises, and two more stand atop the gatehouse. The ground level cor- ridor is 130 feet long and 20 feet wide.
name: Rooms

description: When the encounter begins, both the front gate portcullis and the back gate portcullis are raised. Each is made of iron and is 25 feet wide, 25 feet high, and 6 inches thick, with hardness 8 and 180 hit points. If either portcullis is dropped, the PCs can raise it by making a successful DC 30 Strength check.
name: Portcullis

description: The stone double doors of the rear gatehouse face the inner ward to the south. Each door is 10 feet wide, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick, with hardness 8 and 180 hit points.
name: Doors

name: Subjective Directional Gravity

description: Throughout the tower, the ceilings rise Atk Options expert grappler, trample 2d6+3 20 feet high. Abilities Str 15, Dex 11, Con —, Int —, Wis 10, Cha 8
name: Ceiling Height

description: The stone doors are 10 feet wide and 4 inches thick, SQ mob anatomy, single actions only, undead traits with hardness 8 and 60 hit points. They bear horned demonic Feats Improved Bull RushB, Improved OverrunB, ToughnessB faces with mouths stretched wide open. Skills Listen –2, Spot +2
name: Doors

description: Because of the debilitating nature of the plane, everburning torches spaced around the rim of the bottom level give off only 10 feet of bright light and 20 feet of shadowy illumination.
name: Illumination

description: The ceiling in this room is 40 feet high.
name: Ceiling

description: The promenade stands 20 feet above the bot- tom level of this room.
name: Promenade

description: Because of the debilitating nature of the plane, everburning torches in the corners of the chamber contain- ing the corrupt circle give off only 10 feet of bright light and 20 feet of shadowy light.
name: Illumination

description: The encounter takes place at night, where the desert illumination is limited to the moon and stars. The central fire creates an area of bright illumination in a 20-foot radius and an area of shadowy illumination in a 40-foot radius. If forewarned of the party’s approach, the half-dragons douse the flames to take advantage of their darkvision.
name: Illumination

description: The Al-Iborak tents are made of ordinary cloth and have hardness 0 and 1 hit point. Each tent is supported by a wooden pole that has hardness 5 and 10 hit points. The tents offer concealment but do not provide cover.
name: Tents

description: A dozen desert-bred light war horses (MM 274) are hobbled near the camp. These well-trained animals do not panic when combat breaks out, but they attempt to escape if directly attacked when not under the control of their riders. The Al-Iborak mount their horses only if they need to chase fleeing enemies or if they seek to escape themselves. In that scenario, the Sons of the Dragon simply count themselves fortunate and take any prisoners to Imer for interrogation.
name: Horses

description: The ceilings in the chambers are 12 feet high.
name: F EATURES OF THE A REA Ceilings

description: The main door into the harem chamber is made of features. bronze-bound wood and has hardness 5, 12 hit points, and a
name: The main chamber and the connected rooms have the following Doors

description: During the day, sunlight streams in through the courtyard archway, creating bright illumina- tion in the chamber. At night, braziers flanking the entrance to the great hall provide bright illumination in a 20-foot radius and shadowy illumination in a 40- foot radius. That fails to make much difference in the gloom, but the braziers are meant to provide only token illumination for any servants who might need to enter the chamber at night. Borak and the Al-Iborak have darkvision and do not need the lights.
name: Illumination

description: The domed ceiling rises 45 feet overhead, allowing Borak to rear up to her full height and to get far enough off the ground to make use of her crush attack if she desires.
name: Ceiling

description: Dromites stand about 3 feet tall. Dromites might be mistaken for halfl ings at a distance, due They are essentially humanoid in appearance, if a bit thin. to their diminutive stature. Dromites have no body hair; where a human- eyes like those of an insect, and two small antennae protruding oid might possess a head of hair, a dromite has a thin coating from their brows. Wide- other languages, including obscure ones, and they are fond ly known as planar travelers and marauders, githyanki venture of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other to all corners of the multiverse in search of power and wealth. tongues: Orc curses, Halfl ing culinary terms, Elven musical Personality: Most githyanki are cruel, rapacious marauders expressions, Dwarven military phrases, and so on. who revel in warfare and conquest.
